data.text: The older version is chromoly railed‚Ä¶ and the rubber is a lot more flexible‚Ä¶the new ‚Äúall weather ‚Äú is polymer railed and the rubber seat is very noticeably harder, no where near as comfortable.

data.text: It's completely different. It's hard and requires no maintenance. I love the C17 carved but it definitely helps to get as much compliance from other parts to combine with this saddle. The older models and vegan models seem to have a softer underside than the standard.

data.text: I hated mine. Just decided to nut up and break in a real leather saddle (Brooks Professional). The Cambium is just not comfortable imo. But some people like em ü§∑
data.author: Jeff Emrich

data.text: I actually find C15 carved to be the best saddle I've ever ridden on. It really depends if it fits for your sit bones. Some people have better fit with C17, C19 or their leather ones.
data.author: Bo Ban

data.text: Bo Ban I bought the correct size for my bones. But it's still not to my liking. I found it hard yet bouncy and the surface texture is a bad design imo as it prohibits the subtle movement needed to settle the sit bones where they need to be while the rest of the body is moving as it needs to. And I've also seen long term users of the cambium complaining about wear on their clothing from the saddle texture and the friction it causes and even though it's a weatherproof design the nose on almost all long term tests I've seen wears out and breaks at the front rivet. But like I said, some people like em. We all have different backsides. I kept mine for now as I could see using it on a seldom used bike or on a bike built for quick sale in the future. ‚úåÔ∏è
data.author: Jeff Emrich

data.text: Worst part about these saddles are the sweat stains or marks. After a long ride and I stop at a shop or brewery. My ball/ass sweat is far too evident on the seat.
data.author: Kristopher Wilhelm

data.text: I threw one away after 4-5,000 miles. The rubber around the nose ripped. No more brooks for me. Ever.
data.author: Tom Cavan

data.text: After hating every saddle I‚Äôve had I got a C-17 carved and have loved it for the last 3 years I tried out a C-15 first but it was too narrow for my sit bones REI has C-17‚Äôs but not C-15‚Äôs right now

data.author: Fast Fuso

data.text: Purchase with caution: The vulcanized rubber is prone to splitting near the nose. Had 6 of these that failed and Brooks (Highway 2 - handles North American warranties), wouldn't replace any of them. Would NOT recommend for bikepacking unless you enjoy being left out in the wilds with a broken saddle. I've since come to really enjoy Berthoud Saddles out of France. Not vulcanized rubber (I wish I knew of a good vulcanized rubber saddles option for bikepacking) but an outstanding leather bikepacking saddle.
data.author: Cameron Sanders

data.text: nope
data.author: John Meredith

data.text: nope what?
data.author: Cameron Sanders

data.text: we have 5 of them, some for 10 years and none have done what you mention.
data.author: Mark Courtenay

data.text: then I guess you either got lucky or haven't ridden them as much as I have. Considering this has happened universally to the cambiums me and my partner owned, and to a number of clients I sold saddles to, I can say with absolute certainty that: 1.) There is a durability issue with the cambium saddle. 2.) Brooks does not live up to their warranty. It's a shame, because I really do love the look, ride, and feel of the cambiums... I just can't have saddles splitting on me.
data.author: Cameron Sanders

data.text: they have been part of that empire for about 10 years, but the factory is still in Brum. The saddle names still represent the postcodes of Brum, withthe various designs being inspired by the type of resident in each postcode. üòÉ

data.author: Surachai Lattapanit

data.text: The all-weather has a plastic bridge and a slippery feeling cover. The original has an aluminum bridge and a more natural feeling cotton blend skin, which did not wear well. Though I prefer it, can't find it.
data.author: Greg Johnson

data.text: agree 100% on this model not wearing well. I have owned 3-4 and I have sent them all back to Brooks under warranty replacement to only receive another which experienced the same delaminating issue of the outer layer fraying where my inner legs chaff the saddle. Love the concept of an all weather Brooks, but not the end product in this case.
